documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for wednesday on business live .
we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 tomorrow .
do join us then for all the latest breaking news and analysis from the business world .

documents.title: musk foxes
text: tech entrepreneur elon musk is dropping hints on social media that he is up to something .
the daily beast says several former writers for the satirical news site the onion have confirmed that they are working on a secret comedy project financially backed by mr musk .
in response to the news , today mr musk tweeted the word , `` thud ! ''
to his followers , which could be a clue .
gizmodo thinks it could be the name of his new comedy media enterprise , because the entrepreneur is fond of putting pop culture references into his space and automobile companies .

documents.title: wall street closes lower
text: wall street shares have closed lower , as industrial companies continued to suffer from concerns over the potential impact of new tariffs on trade .
the dow jones fell 249 points to 24,758 .
the s & p 500 also fell 16 points to 2,749 .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq slipped by 14 points to 7,497 .

documents.title: larry kudlow blames china for trade tariffs
text: trump 's incoming economic adviser , tv pundit laurence kudlow , has blamed china for trump 's tough stance on trade tariffs .
`` china has not played by the rules for a long time i must say , as somebody who does n't like tariffs , i think china has earned a tough response , '' said mr kudlow .
although mr kudlow has spoken against tariffs in the past , he said he hoped a coalition of countries could act against china on trade .
he does not feel that tariffs would hurt the broader us economy , and said he was relieved by proposed exclusions for certain countries to the proposed steel and aluminum tariffs .

documents.title: wall street still on a downer
text: the dow jones is currently down 262 points or 1.05 % to 24,745.07 .

boeing is still leading the losers , falling 2.7 % to $ 329.70 on fears of a trade war over trump 's tariffs , while disney has risen 0.21 % to $ 103.95 on the news that it is restructuring its business .
the s & p 500 is now lower , falling 15.6 points or 0.6 % to 2,749.73 .
signet jewelers tops the losers , plunging 19.8 % to $ 38.44 .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is has dropped 17.2 points or 0.23 % to 7,493.77 .
auris medical heads the losers , sliding an epic 34.1 % to $ 1.66 on news its tinnitus treatment has failed a pivotal late-stage study .

documents.title: would you like to back-up your brain ?
text: a start-up that claims it will one day allow people to back-up their brains admits it will come at the ultimate price : death .
nectome has said it will one day be capable of scanning the human brain and preserving it , perhaps running a deceased person 's mind as a computer simulation .
however , its current process requires a fresh brain .
the product is `` 100 % fatal '' , the team behind it told mit technology review .

documents.title: amazon recalls fire-risk power packs in uk , europe and us
text: owners of amazon 's own-brand power bank chargers have been contacted by the firm telling them to stop using them .
a recall covering six models of the amazon basics-branded product was announced in the us and canada on tuesday .
a notice posted by the us consumer product safety commission ( cpsc ) warned the packs could `` overheat and ignite , posing fire and burn hazards '' .

documents.title: etsy told to remove 'vile ' greeting cards
text: `` vile '' greeting cards featuring karen matthews and jimmy savile should be removed from sale , a charity has said .
the nspcc has described the mother 's day and father 's day cards , which are drawn in a cartoon style , as `` thoughtless and irresponsible '' .
freelance illustrator samuel hague , who sells the pieces via online marketplace etsy , defended his work and said he does `` not condone any acts of child abuse whatsoever '' .
etsy has been approached for comment .

documents.title: mail online warned over oxford circus panic incident
text: the independent press standards organisation ( ipso ) has warned the mail online over its coverage of the incident at oxford circus in november , which saw pedestrians and shoppers flee the shopping district .
members of the public tweeted that they had heard gunshots , but the reports were eventually found to be false .
the mail online has been criticised for publishing some of the comments made on social media , including reports that a lorry had `` ploughed into pedestrians '' .

numerous complaints were made over the article , especially because the mail online did not publish a correction - instead it deleted an erroneous tweet and amended the article , according to press gazette .
ipso said that publications reporting on breaking news stories must take `` appropriate care '' over the accuracy of what is published .

text: radio 5 live presenter danni hewson tweets about morrisons ' plans to help the environment
re push back on single use # plastic @ twitterid chief executive david potts said by the end of april this year we will have got rid of single use plastic carrier bags .

documents.title: we still want your business
text: we do n't want your spies and we certainly do n't want your assassins but we do want to keep doing business with you .

that seemed to be the message from the prime minister as she announced a robust diplomatic and security response but took a less aggressive line on the significant trade and investment ties between the uk and russia .
it was always going to be very difficult to retaliate financially without risking important business interests .

bp 's 20 % stake in the state-controlled oil giant rosneft accounts for nearly a third of its global oil production , and the uk companie 's chief executive sits on a board chaired by close putin associate igor sechin .
there are dozens of russian companies listed in the uk and russian business - people have significant interests in property , football and publishing .
to those russians who live and operate perfectly legal business here , - in the prime ministers words `` make an important contribution to the uk '' - there was a message of continuing welcome .

life wo n't get any more comfortable for the russian rich who have made the uk a home from home , but there was little in today 's statement that will make it more difficult for business to flow in both directions .
it will be interesting to see if the russian response to this powerful diplomatic retaliation will similarly avoid using business as a weapon of choice .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: what will the future of cars look like ?
text: robot taxis , funky lights , a living room on wheels : the geneva motor show gives us a glimpse into the future of motoring .

documents.title: uk government warns of travel risks
text: following the government 's decision to expel 23 russian diplomats , foreign office has warned britons who are currently in russia or looking to travel to russia that they could be at risk of `` anti-british sentiment or harassment '' .
british ministers and royals will no longer attend world cup 2018 , which begins in moscow , before moving on to other parts of the country .

documents.title: breakingtv pundit lawrence kudlow 'to be trump economic adviser '
text: us president donald trump is to television commentator lawrence kudlow to be his top economic adviser , us media reports .
mr kudlow will reportedly lead the national economic council after gary cohn quit last week .

documents.title: disney announces corporate reorganisation
text: disney has announced that it is restructuring its business operations to bring its direct-to-consumer services , technology and studio and media networks into one single world-wide business .
its consumer products division will merge with the parks operations unit , and all stories , characters and franchises will be managed by this new unit .

meanwhile , responsibility for international disney channels , its upcoming streaming service , as well as management of global advertising sales , will move to a new division called `` direct-to-consumer and international '' .

documents.title: ftse finishes flat
text: the ftse 100 share index has closed higher - just - at 7,143 , after gaining 4 points .
news of prudential 's demerger sent its shares up more than 5 % , while supermarket chain morrison closed 5 % down after a special dividend and an investor focus on cash flow .
meanwhile , the ftse 250 closed lower , down 43.11 points or 0.22 % to 19,820.12 .
the top loser was the dairy crest group , which fell 7.57 % to 507p .

documents.title: 'no plans ' to scrap 1p and 2p coins
text: downing street said there are no plans to scrap either 1p or 2p coins .
a consultation is underway to help the government better understand the role of cash and digital payments in the economy .
`` one of the elements was whether the denominational mix of coins meets the public need , '' said the prime minister 's spokesman .
`` from the early reaction it looks as if it does . ''

documents.title: breakingsec charges theranos founder
text: the securities and exchange commission has charged theranos , the silicon valley-based blood testing company , its founder and chief executive elizabeth holmes ( and former president ramesh sunny '' balwani , with raising more than $ 700m from investors through an elaborate , years-long fraud .
the regulator said they exaggerated or made false statements about the company 's technology , business , and financial performance .
the sec said theranos and ms holmes have agreed to resolve the charges against them .
as well as paying a penalty , ms holmes will lose control of the company .
she will also be banned from being an officer or director of a public company for 10 years .

documents.title: coinbase gains a uk money licence
text: one of the world 's largest cryptocurrency exchanges coinbase says it has obtained an e-money licence in the uk , and opened a bank account with barclays .
according to bloomberg , the licence will allow coinbase to issue e-money and provide payment services in the uk .
these rights will also allow the firm to do business and strike partnerships in over 20 other european union countries .

documents.title: guardian reports 11.3 % gender pay gap
text: guardian news & media has announced that there is an 11.3 % gender pay gap at the media organisation .
gnm said that 65 % of its top-paid workers are men , while 57 % of the lowest paid are women .
in editorial , there is a gender pay gap of 7.4 % , while in non-editorial roles , the hourly pay gap is 17.2 % .

katharine viner , the editor-in-chief , and david pemsel , the chief executive , said in a joint statement : `` more must be done to improve women 's representation and ensure there are opportunities for everyone at gnm to progress .
`` within five years we aim to achieve a 50:50 gender balance in the top half of the organisation . ''

documents.title: unilever might give up its london headquarters
text: consumer goods giant unilever is allegedly looking to give up its british headquarters in london , according to sky news .
instead , unilever could move its base to the netherlands .
unilever 's board of directors has yet to confirm the decision , sources told sky news .
an official announcement will be made on thursday .

documents.title: wall street opens flat
text: wall street shares opened flat on wednesday , as industrial companies continued to suffer from concerns over the potential impact of new tariffs on trade .

the dow jones fell 49.7 points or 0.2 % to 24,957.31 on open , with the losers led by boeing , which fell 2 % to $ 331.84 on fears it could be heavily impacted if trump imposes tariffs on chinese goods , as this could prompt a backlash from china .

the s & p 500 edged up 0.66 points or 0.02 % to 2,765.97 , with ford the top winner up 3.39 % to $ 11.15 , despite reports it has initiated a massive recall of cars in the us over a steering wheel problem .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq increased by 10.9 points or 0.15 % to 7,521.94 .

the top winner on the index was biotechnology firm proteostasis therapeutics , which announced that it received approval from the food and drug administration ( fda ) for its breakthrough cystic fibrosis treatment .

documents.title: equifax responds
text: equifax is responding to the insider trading case filed against its former chief information officer .
jun ying is accused of selling almost $ 1m in stock after he learned of a massive cyber breach but before the credit bureau disclosed the problem publicly .
the firm says it reviewed his trading activity , `` separated him from the company and reported our findings to government authorities '' .
it said : `` we are fully cooperating with the doj and the sec , and will continue to do so .
we take corporate governance and compliance very seriously , and will not tolerate violations of our policies . ''
equifax in november said an internal investigation had cleared four other executives of improper activity .

documents.title: former equifax staff charged with insider trading
text: a former equifax employee has been charged with insider trading for selling almost $ 1m in stock after learning of the massive data breach last year .
the securities and exchange commission , a top us financial regulator , and federal prosecutors have brought the legal case .
jun ying , a former chief information officer , is the first person to be charged with insider trading tied to the breach at the credit bureau .
the breach exposed data of more than 145 million americans and brits and has spurred calls for tougher laws about cybersecurity .

documents.title: warning for toys r us customers
text: if you 've been hanging onto a toys r us gift voucher , you 've lost out now the company is to shut all its stores , warns hannah maundrell of money.co.uk .
`` the deadline has now passed to use gift cards in store and online so these are now unlikely to be accepted , '' she said .
however toys 'r ' us has said all orders received before it went into administration will be fulfilled or refunded .
`` if you are still waiting for your delivery today then you need to log your order as missing , '' she advised .
`` toys 'r ' us are no longer accepting items for exchange or refunds . ''

documents.title: watch : the dark side of south korea gaming
text: the recent death of an employee at a south korean video game developer has sparked calls to change `` crunch time '' , a period of high intensity work just before a game is released .

documents.title: treasury responds to ifs £ 40bn claim
text: the treasury has responded to claims from the institute for fiscal studies that tax rises of £ 40bn are needed by the mid-2020s if the government wants to balance its books .
a treasury spokesperson said : our balanced approach has reduced the deficit while also cutting taxes for over 30 million people and investing in our vital public services .
`` we are training more doctors , more schools are rated as outstanding and we are funding the second largest defence budget in nato .
`` thanks to the hard work of the british people we will now see the first sustained fall in debt in 17 years . ''

documents.title: facebook bans britain first pages
text: facebook has removed the pages of the anti-islamic group britain first and its leaders .
the social media company said the group had repeatedly violated its community standards .
earlier this month , britain first 's leader and deputy leader , paul golding and jayda fransen , were jailed after being found guilty of religiously aggravated harassment .
more than two million people had liked the group 's facebook page .

documents.title: sportech shares slump 55 %
text: shares in betting company sportech have slumped 55 % today to 35p after it issued a profit warning and revealed that takeover talks have failed .
the company said that trading had been `` challenging '' in the first 10 weeks of the year and appointed a new chief executive andrew gaughan with immediate effect .

documents.title: itn reveals 19.6 % gender pay gap
text: itn - which produces daily news programmes for itv , channel 4 and channel 5 - has revealed it has a 19.6 % gender pay gap .
the network also announced a bonus gap of 77.2 % .
it compares with a report on bbc staff which found the equivalent gender pay gap was 10.7 % .
itn said the gap was `` mainly caused by there being fewer women than men in many of the most senior roles in the company '' .

documents.title: toys r us to extend discounts
text: toys r us joint administrator simon thomas says : `` all of the remaining 75 toys r '' us and babies r '' us stores will remain open until further notice .
`` we 're extending the nationwide discounting programme and would like to encourage customers to take advantage of the special offers available in store while stock levels remain high . ''

documents.title: 'no party able to move forward ' with toys r us rescue
text: simon thomas , the joint administrator of toys r us , says : we have made every effort to secure a buyer for all or part of the company 's business .
this process attracted some interest , but ultimately no party has been able to move forward with a formal bid prior to the expiration of the stated deadline .

it is therefore with great regret that we have made the difficult decision to make a number of positions redundant at the company 's head office in maidenhead and proceed with a controlled store closure programme . ''

documents.title: uk to 'harden our defences '
text: theresa may said the government would `` urgently develop proposals '' for new legislative powers to `` harden our defenses against all forms of hostile state activity '' .
she said : `` this will include the addition of a targeted power to detain those suspected of hostile state activity at the uk border . ''

the prime minister has also asked home secretary amber rudd to consider whether there is a need for new counter-espionage powers to `` clamp down on the full spectrum of hostile activities of foreign agents in our country '' .

documents.title: diplomat expulsion is biggest in 30 yearstheresa may describes vladimir putin 's action as 'tragic '
text: theresa may said the expulsion of 23 more russian diplomats was the biggest expulsion in 30 years .
she said that the government will also table an amendment to strengthen sanctions against the abuse of human right and freeze russian state assets wherever there is evidence of a threat .
she said president putin 's actions are `` tragic '' .

documents.title: us retail sales dip
text: us retail sales fell in february , according to the commerce department .
it said that sales dipped by 0.1 % last month against analysts ' expectations of 0.3 % growth .
excluding sales of cars , however , trade rose by 0.1 % in february .

documents.title: inditex staff cash in on profits rise with £ 5,500 bonus
text: about 88,000 staff at zara-owner inditex are to share more than €562m ( £ 499m ) in bonuses and commission after world 's biggest fashion chain posted a 7 % rise in profits .
the bonus and commission windfall includes a €42m ( £ 37.3m ) extra payout under its profit-sharing plan and will be made to all staff working at the group for more than two years .
it means the average payout will be around £ 5,500 per staff member .

documents.title: toys r us make redundancies
text: more on toys r us
the administrators are in the process of shutting down stores and 541 people will have been made redundant as of tomorrow .
around 2,500 people continue to be employed as the administrators proceed with closing its remaining stores in the uk .

documents.title: 99p pricing looks safe
text: reader sean hearne contacts us to report that australia leads the way when it comes to doing without small denomination coins , it scrapped 1 cent and 2 cent pieces back in 1992 .
so how does it deal with 99p pricing ?
`` the 99p price can remain on an individual product but its just the total that is rounded .
it 's rounded up in some cases and down in others , so will average out , '' he says .
there could be some pointers for the british government in the australian rounding rules .

documents.title: breakingtoys r us set to close , 3,000 jobs to go
text: toys r us is set to close its uk stores it is understood , after the company 's administrators failed to find a buyer for the retailer .
it is believed that all 3,000 jobs at the company will go and all its stores will be closed within the next six weeks .

documents.title: morrisons shares slide
text: the ftse 100 has extended gains and is now trading up 27.85 points at 7,166.63 .
prudential continues to lead the risers after announcing that a demerger which will spin off its uk business and its m & g fund management arm into a separately-listed company .
its share price is up 5.5 % at £ 19.26 .
morrisons is the biggest faller , with its share price down 3.4 % at 218.4p despite reporting strong full-year sales .
the ftse 250 is ahead 50.98 points at 19,914.21 .
sterling is hovering near $ 1.40 on a weaker dollar as markets took stock of the surprise dismissal of us secretary of state rex tillerson .

documents.title: broadcom - disappointed but compliant
text: broadcom said in a statement that although it was disappointed that the us government had intervene to stop its takeover of us chip maker qualcomm , it said : `` broadcom will comply with the order . ''

it added that it `` appreciates '' a statement from us treasury secretary and chairman of the committee on foreign investment in the united states steven mnuchin , who said : `` this decision is based on the facts and national security sensitivities related to this particular transaction only and is not intended to make any other statement about broadcom or its employees , including its thousands of hard working and highly skilled u.s .
employees . ''

documents.title: breakingbroadcom abandons qualcomm takeover
text: singapore-based broadcom has abandoned its $ 140bn bid for qualcomm following an intervention by us president donald trump who cited national security concerns .

documents.title: 150 jobs to go at fife docks
text: around 150 further jobs will go at the babcock dockyard in rosyth in fife , the engineering company said .
it was announced in november that around 250 jobs would be going at the site as its contract to build two royal navy aircraft carriers neared completion .
the additional posts will be cut after the firm spent months reviewing its operations .
full story here

documents.title: troubled conviviality in surprise £ 30m tax bill
text: bargain booze owner conviviality has revealed that it owes the tax authorities £ 30m .

the troubled group , which saw its shares collapse last week following a profit warning , said it has `` identified a payment due to hm revenue & customs '' falling due on 29 march that has not been accounted for within its short-term projections .
conviviality said the discovery has `` created a short-term funding requirement '' and resulted in operational difficulties that could negatively impact profits .
shares in the firm were suspended ahead of the announcement .

`` the reality of the economic and fiscal challenges facing us ought to be at the very top of the news agenda , '' he says

`` and i mean the reality , not the spin and bluster of politicians on all sides pretending there are easy solutions , that the promised land is just around the corner , or that they can reinvent the laws of economics .

documents.title: raising tax from the digital economy
text: the ifs ' paul johnson says the chancellor has a big challenge in clawing taxes from global digital firms .
he says : `` even at a conceptual level , we do n't know how to assess the value created by users .

`` and even if we could find practical ways to allocate profits based on user input , this would imply a reallocation of taxable profits away from some countries , including the us , and towards others , such as the uk .
`` getting general agreement on that will be challenging , to say the least . ''

documents.title: taxing challenge for hammond
text: paul johnson of the ifs says that philip hammond would face challenges in raises enough taxes to balance the uk 's budget by the mid-2020s .
he says : `` he has been unable to tackle the problems posed by the increasing numbers of self employed and company owner managers , who pay less tax than similarly remunerated employees .
`` he - like his predecessor - looks wholly unable to maintain the real value of fuel duties . ''

and he adds : `` by taking huge numbers of people out of the income tax net , while raising tax on those with the highest incomes , we have become very dependent on a very small number of taxpayers to pay a very large fraction of the overall tax bill .
`` if high paid jobs ( and eu citizens , who are well represented among high earners in the uk ) relocate elsewhere the consequences for the exchequer will be severe . ''

documents.title: ifs : make that £ 41bn chancellor
text: paul johnson of the ifs says the £ 30bn the chancellor may need to achieve budget balance may not even be enough .

he says : `` additional demographic pressures could add another £ 11bn a year to the money the government would need to find from somewhere in 2025 if it wants to cover the additional demands for health , pension and social care spending . ''

documents.title: spring statement : chancellor needs £ 30bn in tax rises
text: chancellor philip hammond would need to raise £ 30bn worth of tax to achieve budget balance by the mid-2020s according to paul johnson , director of the institute for fiscal studies .
he says : `` just to avoid spending falling as a fraction of national income beyond 2019-20 he would need to find an additional £ 14bn a year , relative to current plans , by 2022-23 .
`` on the other hand if he really wants to eliminate the deficit by the mid 2020s he would need to find an additional £ 18bn or so of tax increases or spending cuts by the mid 2020s .

`` put these two together and on current forecasts , just keeping spending constant as a fraction of national income beyond 2019-20 and reaching budget balance by the mid-2020s would require tax rises of £ 30bn a year .

documents.title: spring statement : where will growth come from ?
text: paul johnson , director of the institute for fiscal studies , says that the new forecasts that emerged in the spring statement that government spending will be some £ 4bn lower than expected is good news in the short-term .
in the ifs 's response to the spring statement , he said : `` that good news largely washes out over the next few years . ''

he says this is due to a number of reasons including that the office for budget responsibility `` now believes the economy to be operating slightly above capacity : slightly better economic growth in 2017 is offset by slightly worse growth later on '' .
he says : `` we have had the worst decade of growth since at least the last war .
the economy is at least £ 300bn smaller than we might have expected based on 2008 forecasts .
yet we are now supposed to be at capacity , with no potential to make up for any of that loss . ''

documents.title: remortgage figures reach nine-year high
text: the number of people remortgaging reached a nine-year high in january as a high number of fixed rate deals came to an end , according to uk finance .
there were 49,800 remortgages completed , the highest monthly number since november 2008 and around a fifth higher than in january 2017 .
the number of first-time buyer loans climbed 7 % over the year to 24,500 .
uk finance said the average first-time buyer is 30 and has a gross household income of £ 41,000 .

documents.title: women-only : 'be careful what you wish for '
text: so do readers think a women's-only work space is a good idea ?
lawrie bryans does n't and says : `` be careful what you wish for - segregation has always led to inequality . ''
let us know your thoughts at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: chancellor targets vat on online sales
text: card issuers and other processing firms could end up as effectively being tax collectors under vat proposals included in the spring statement .
heather self of blick rothenberg tells the bbc 's today programme that the chancellor is keen to collect tax that is due from online retailers not paying vat .
`` a technical solution has been proposed of collecting a slice of the tax due from the vat via one of the people on the processing chain , '' she explains .
under the proposals they would pass on part of any payments received to the tax authorities .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: will prices rise 1 % if copper coins go ?
text: more views on the planned scrapping of copper coins .
george leith has an interesting poser for retailers : `` if the penny and tuppenny piece are withdrawn , what will all the shops do with their ubiquitous 99p pricing .
raise their prices to the whole pound , or drop to 95p ? ''
what do you reckon ?
would retailers really leap at the chance to raise prices at a stroke by just over 1 % ?
let us know at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: tigger v eeyore : the reckoning
text: chancellor philip hammond said he was feeling positively `` tigger-ish '' when he gave his spring statement on tuesday .
the resolution foundation , the think tank , examines if there are reasons to be as bouncy as tigger or more downcast like eeyore
from our spring statement analysis - reasons to be 'tiggerish ' # 1 - borrowing has been revised down in every year
reasons to be tiggerish # 2 - the current budget deficit is on course to be eliminated next year
reasons to be tiggerish # 3 - debt as a share of gdp is set to start falling next year
eyeore 's retort # 1 - the productivity bounce back is expected to prove illusory
eyeore 's retort # 2 - yes the economy is projected to be £ 3bn bigger than forecast last november , but it 's projected to be £ 36bn smaller than forecast last march
eyeore 's retort # 3 - pre-crisis earnings are not forecast to return until 2025 , that would mean an unprecedented 17-year pay downturn

the chancellor 's tough balancing act - spending more on public services , delivering tax cuts , maintaining the falling debt to gdp trajectory and reaching the end of the austerity tunnel in the next parliament
austerity is n't over # 1 - the overall deficit is on course to be eliminated in 2027-28 .
the light at the end of the tunnel is a decade away
austerity is n't over # 2 - more departmental spending cuts are coming , though rapid increases in capital spend are also forecast
austerity is n't over # 3 - four fifths of the welfare cuts announced in the summer 2015 budget are still to come .
the scale of cuts is set to grow over the next two years
the chancellor faces tough choices on squaring the circle of meeting his fiscal rules while ending austerity and delivering tax cuts .
he needs to raise taxes or 'beat the forecasts ' .
summary - he should plan the former , while hoping for the latter

documents.title: morrisons 'winning ' retail battle
text: laith khalaf , senior analyst , hargreaves lansdown reckons morrisons ' profit jump points to a positive future for the supermarket chain .
he said :
the retail sector is polarising into winners and losers , as a result of tough trading conditions and changing consumer behaviour .
there are a number of battlefronts , with the biggest one being drawn between online retail and the high street .
morrisons is carving out a place in the winner 's camp .

documents.title: the end of copper coins : a blow for tulips
text: readers have been emailing in with comments about the government 's consultation on currencies which could potentially lead to the 1p and 2p coins being scrapped .
chris stone makes the point : `` the question the government should really be asking is if they end copper coins , what will we put in our vases with tulips ?
is this part of their strategy to restrict growth ? ''
keep your comments coming to bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: cathay pacific reports first consecutive loss
text: hong kong 's flagship carrier cathay pacific has posted its first back-to-back annual loss since the company was founded in 1946 .
the airline blamed intense competition from low-cost chinese carriers and higher fuel prices , among other issues , for the result .
losses came to 1.26bn hong kong dollars ( $ 161m ; £ 115m ) for the year to december , the firm said .
cathay is part way through a huge three-year cost cutting programme .
in march last year , it posted its first annual loss in eight years .

documents.title: london stock markets reverse falls
text: the ftse 100 has now turned positive , up 10.88 points at 7,149.66 .
prudential led the risers , up 4.77 % at £ 19.12 after it announced that it would split itself in two by demerging its m & g fund management business .
miners made up the rest of the risers , lead by anglo american whose share price is up 2.2 % at £ 17.69 .
banking group standard chartered is the largest faller , down 1.75 % at 763.4p .
the ftse 250 is up 9.26 points at 19,872.49 .

documents.title: co-op bank losses shrink
text: the struggling co-op bank has reported a fifth consecutive year of losses .
in 2017 , it lost £ 140.3m but that was down from almost £ 500m the previous year .
its performance improved in the second half of the year after agreeing a £ 700m rescue deal that left the former mutual almost entirely owned by hedge funds .

documents.title: asia markets slide
text: markets in asia were in negative territory on wednesday after us president donald trump fired his secretary of state rex tillerson and looked set to implement tariffs on chinese imports .
the benchmark nikkei 225 ended the day down 0.9 % to 21,777.29 points .
in australia , the s & p/asx 200 index ended lower by 0.7 % to 5935.3 points , weighed down by the big banks amid a government-backed inquiry into the country 's lenders .
in china , hong kong 's hang seng index was down 1.31 % in mid-afternoon trade , while the shanghai composite was down 0.57 % .
south korea 's benchmark kospi index ended the day down 0.34 % to 2486 points .

documents.title: pru shares climb 5 % on demerger news
text: shares in insurer prudential have jumped 4.79 % to £ 19.09 after it announced that it will split its uk operation from its us and asian business .

documents.title: london markets open lower
text: the ftse 100 opened 6.59 points lower at 7,132.19 .
the ftse 250 is off 4.68 points at 19,858.55 .

documents.title: pru posts profits leap on asia growth
text: insurance giant prudential , which announced it was demerging its m & g investment arm , said full-year profits for 2017 rose to £ 2.39bn from £ 1.9bn .
prudential 's chief executive mike wells said the rise was `` led by double-digit growth in our asia business '' .
he added that splitting the two businesses would allow the pru `` to focus on the attractive returns and growth potential of its market-leading businesses in asia and the us '' .

documents.title: dignity looks to consultants to boost funeral business
text: earlier this year , dignity said that it would reduce or hold some of its funeral prices .
it has now retained l.e.k .
consulting to advise it on a strategy for the funeral business which will include testing out different price and service combinations .
it said that its crematoria business `` continues to perform well `` .
dignity said of the three new crematoria currently under construction , `` the first should open in the second quarter of 2018 '' .

documents.title: profits flat for funeral specialist dignity
text: funeral specialist dignity has reported a 3 % rise in revenue to £ 324m for the year to 29 december .
however , it said that profit was flat at £ 71.2m and the rate of deaths in the uk remained at 590,000 .
looking ahead , it said that the office for national statistics anticipates approximately 580,000 deaths in 2018 , a small decrease of 10,000 on the actual deaths in 2017 .
`` however , the number of deaths in the first two months of 2018 are approximately 7 % higher than the prior year . ''

documents.title: balfour beatty benefits from carillion collapse
text: balfour beatty 's chief executive leo quinn tells the bbc 's today programme that carillion 's collapse helped britain 's biggest engineering firm .
`` reducing a major competitor from the market that was underpricing us all was helpful , '' he says .
he says balfour has taken on 150 former carillion workers .
`` these are people that we 've worked side-by-side with on joint ventures , '' he explains .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: balfour beatty on the right track
text: british engineering giant balfour beatty reported a sharp rise in pre-tax profits to £ 117m for 2017 , up from £ 10m the previous year .
annual revenue was flat £ 6.9bn .
the company behind crossrail said it is on track for industry-standard margins in the second half of 2018 , after a difficult few years .
balfour beatty 's chief executive leo quinn said : `` the group has been repositioned to drive sustainable growth in profits , underpinned by a strong balance sheet . ''

documents.title: morrisons fights off headwinds
text: commenting on its results for the year to 4 february , morrisons 's chief executive david potts , said : `` we had a strong year , becoming more competitive and increasingly differentiating morrisons for all stakeholders . ''
underlying pre-tax profits rose by 11 % to £ 374m , ahead of analysts ' forecasts of a 10 % rise to £ 371m .
the uk 's fourth largest supermarket chain admitted that there had been challenges during the year `` particularly the impact of higher imported cost of goods inflation and other cost headwinds '' .
however , it said : `` our core supermarkets are showing strong annual growth on growth as we enter a fourth year of turnaround , driven by more customers and more volume . ''

documents.title: adidas bullish on profits
text: sportswear giant adidas said operating profit climbed 31 % to €2.1bn ( £ 1.8bn ) last year and has made bullish noises about the next few years .
it said it expects net profits will rise faster over the next three years than previously targeted , climbing 22-24 % .
adidas 's chief executive kasper rorsted said : `` we made great progress toward achieving our mission to be the best sports company in the world . ''

documents.title: prudential to demerge fund management arm
text: prudential , the insurance giant , has announced that it will split the business in two .
it will separate its uk operation and fund management arm from its us and asian divisions into separately-listed businesses .
it added : `` on completion of the demerger , shareholders will hold interests in both prudential plc and m & g prudential . ''

documents.title: breakingmorrisons full-year sales and profits jump
text: wm morrison has reported a rise in profits to £ 380m from £ 325m for the full-year on sales up 5.8 % at £ 17.3bn
like-for-like sales grew by 2.8 % .

documents.title: round up or round down ?
text: if the treasury does get rid of copper coins , what will it mean for consumers ?

sarah coles , personal finance analyst at hargreaves lansdown , says : `` if you look back to the 1980s when the 1/2p was withdrawn , in 1985 inflation rose 0.5 % and in all the commentary around way inflation had risen , the 1/2p was n't mentioned .
`` at the time , the supermarkets pledged to round prices down as a sort of competitive advantage .
so while there will be a certain amount of rounding up when eventually these coins do go , i think it 's not going to be the dramatic impact people are necessarily expecting . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: zara-owner makes £ 3bn but sales ease
text: zara-owner inditex has reported a slowdown in sales .
net profit in the 12 months to the end of january reached €3.4bn ( £ 3.02bn ) , up 7 % .
but same-store sales at the world 's largest clothing retailer climbed just 5 % in the second half , down from 6 % in the first half .

documents.title: have your say : a working space only for women
text: there have been men-only clubs for centuries .
the wing is a co-working space in new york exclusively for women .
should there be more like this around the world ?
what do you think ?
email us at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: how the penny became too expensive
text: sarah coles , personal finance analyst at hargreaves lansdown , says : `` inflation is eroding the value of these coins and at the same time demand for each of these coins is dropping .

the [ treasury consultation ] paper points out that back in 2006 , 7.2 billion transactions were under £ 1 whereas by 2026 that 's expected to fall to 1.3 billion so it 's a real dramatic drop in the number of these coins being used .

the problem is then , the fixed costs of making and making and distributing coins is roughly the same you 're spreading out that cost over far fewer coins which means each coin costs more to produce and it gets to the point where it is not economically viable to be running these 1ps and 2ps . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: a slice of big tech pie
text: heather self , tax partner at accountancy firm blick rothenberg explains why chief executive philip hammond has set up a consultation getting more tax out of the tech titans such as facebook , google and amazon .
`` the uk wants a slice of the pie but it ca n't work out how to calculate it , '' she tells the bbc 's today programme .
`` the paper sets out a potential long-term solution , but it involves all the member companies of the oecd agreeing to new international tax rules , which is unlikely .
`` an interim solution is proposed which is tax on the basis of revenues , but that 's even more tricky as you can have turnover without profits . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: end of the copper coin ?
text: as the chancellor gave his spring statement on tuesday , it emerged that the government was launching a consultation on the future of cash and digital payments - potentially meaning the end of 1p and 2p coins .

sarah coles , personal finance analyst at hargreaves lansdown , says it is a subject that the bank of england 's governor mark carney spoke about in 2016 - he oversaw the dropping of the penny in canada .
`` there comes a point really with every coin where it costs more to produce and distribute it than it is worth itself . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: google to ban cryptocurrency adverts
text: google has announced a ban on advertisements for cryptocurrencies and related content starting in june .
under the new policy , google said it will ban ads for unregulated or speculative financial products like binary options , cryptocurrency and financial spread betting among others .

documents.title: all talk and very little action
text: why has n't the government implemented a law to make businesses pay their suppliers in a timely manner ?
ian cass , managing director of the forum of private business , says : `` they 're obviously scared for some reason .
maybe it 's too close to some of the big businesses , they do n't want to upset them .

`` it just seems logical to me that they should be taking firmer action then they are doing at the moment and another consultation - who are they going to consult with that they have n't talked to already ? ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: same song , different tune
text: philip hammond 's promise in his spring statement to help small businesses by cracking down on late payers is nothing new says ian cass , managing director of the forum of private business .
`` they 've looked at it before , they looked at it when tony blair 's government was there , '' he tells wake up to money .
`` the enterprise bill has passed , we 've now got a small business commissioner whose job it is to chase up late payment and he can write stern letters to people of they 're not paying on time .
`` but i really do n't understand why they ca n't get a handle on this rather than just giving rough guidelines as to payment terms .
why not just make 30 days a legal requirement to pay in that time ?
`` you and i have to do it when we 're paying our credit cards - if we overrun we get penalised for it , why ca n't they do that with business ? ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live
